column1: The feeling between the Americans of the two different parties was more violent than that between the patriots and the British troops
column2: and before long it became entirely unsafe for any Tory to remain in his own home in New Jersey. Many of them went to New York
column3: where the patriotic feeling was not so strong at that time
column4: and there they formed themselves into a regular military company called the "Associated Loyalists"; and this company was commanded by William Temple Franklin
column5: son of the great Benjamin Franklin
column6: who had been appointed Governor of New Jersey by the British Crown. He was now regarded with great hatred by the patriots of New Jersey
column7: because he was a strong Tory. This difference of opinion between William Franklin and his father was the most noted instance of this state of feeling which occurred in those days.
